alert.note: Alert for Calumet (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 2:43PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Calumet County through 330 PM CDT... At 242 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Jericho, or 10 miles southwest of Chilton. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, half inch hail and torrential rainfall. Street flooding is possible in Jericho. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Calumet County, including the following locations... Jericho, Brothertown and Quinney. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
